intro: Doselia galilensis, commonly known as the Galilee dosel, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Doselia galilensis is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates, such as Israel and parts of Lebanon.
